intro: Triplaris caracasana var. vargasii, commonly known as the Caracas holly or Vargas holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in parts of Venezuela and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a leathery texture. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hard seeds.
